instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>  1,2v
the thermal imaging camera showed the heating up <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> has been replaced

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>  1,2v 3,3V

the computer restarts for 13 seconds
no sound during startup

PRAM reset....  nothing changes
attempting to run in SMC bypass  (the fans are running at full speed, no startup sound, no picture and no picture backlight, power consumption 20v 2.5a)

Is that enough to say damaged GPU CPU ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
2.5A is too much, considering battery is not connected.

Do you get voltage on all coils, including CPU core and GPU?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
I will give voltage in the evening.

you can help with what kind of bios I can trust

<TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR> damaged ?

2/3 <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL>  0.00V 670k drops to 87k ohm
4 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>         12.58V 0,83M ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
Bad CPU probably.
Keep in mind, these boards suffer by FDMF6808 issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
What should be done to be 100% sure that the processor is damaged ?

thermovision record:

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1O2JTJX4t47nBXCWXNUjwHwytfZnKo8eT/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not started
threads.message:
This is not an exact science.
We don't have the test tools like the manufacturer.
GPU can also fail, or RAM.
Could be even just a cracked resistor, or trace.
You can test BIOS and inspect the board.
Changing CPU power supply chips I don't think to help in this case.
